title: The Neurodiversity Paradigm: Educational Psychologists’ Attitudes
summary: Shifts among Irish educational psychologists toward neurodiversity-affirming practice.

title: Including Autistic Pupils with Significant Learning Disabilities
summary: Inclusive practices for autistic students with significant learning disabilities (A/SLD).

title: Neurodiversity and Learning Engagement in Higher Education (MELA)
summary: Framework and instrument to measure learning engagement for autistic, ADHD, and anxious students.

title: Neurodiversity Affirming Approach for School Counselors
summary: Critiques behaviorist treatments and promotes affirming autistic traits in school counseling.

title: Autism, Employment & Organizational Inclusion
summary: Anthropological analysis of autistic employment challenges and organizational cultures.

title: Disability in Education from a Neurodiversity Standpoint
summary: Examines systemic failures in education/justice and advocates for neuro-inclusive spaces.

title: Autism-Centred University Belonging Model (AC-UBM)
summary: Model for fostering belonging among autistic students in higher education.

title: Belonging and Flourishing for Autistic Postsecondary Students
summary: Appreciative inquiry into well-being and inclusion in academia.

title: Neurodiversity-Affirming Practices in Primary Education
summary: How K–3 teachers promote inclusion and neurodiversity-affirming practices.

title: Intersectional Neurodivergent Identity & Belonging
summary: Neuroqueer theory on masking, stigma, and online neurodivergent communities.

title: Professional Development for Neurodiversity in Early Childhood Education
institution: TAFE SA Centre of Excellence, Australia
summary: Training strategies for educators using identity-first language and social models of disability.

title: Ecological Systems Theory & Neurodivergent Students in Higher Education
summary: Applies ecological systems theory to analyze barriers/supports for autistic and ADHD students.

title: Strategies for Promoting Neurodiversity in Higher Education
summary: Addresses barriers faced by autistic students in Latin American and global contexts.
